Publications

Ultimaker

Since 2017 I have worked Ultimaker, a leading desktop 3D printing company with offices in the Netherlands, USA, and Singapore. Ultimaker’s mission is to accelerate the world’s transition to local manufacturing and digital distribution. During my time here I have worked within the Marketing and R&D departments and have produced various forms of content to attract customers to the Ultimaker brand.

Product pages

Ultimaker Cura (The most popular page of Ultimaker.com)

Ultimaker materials

Ultimaker applications

Localization

In 2019 I worked on a project to translate Ultimaker.com’s buying journey into German, French, Italian, Spanish, Korean, and Japanese. This boosted Ultimaker’s reach to thousands more customers all over the world.

White papers

I have written and published several white papers about 3D printing technology to generate leads for Ultimaker’s marketing automation platform.

5 ways to stop wasting money on production processes

Important 3D printing software features

DFRobot

Between 2015 - 2017 I lived in Shanghai, where I worked at DFRobot - a manufacturer of open source electronics catering to industry and STEM education. Besides maintaining keeping a product wiki up to date and tinkering with robots and 3D printers all day, I managed a community for their flagship product “LattePanda” - a powerful single board computer, which we successfully promoted through several influential channels.

March 13, 2017: “The Formonium” - a musical instrument based around a LattePanda

March 2, 2017: Using a LattePanda as an IOT platform

December 14, 2016: Using physical inputs to control visual outputs using LattePanda

December 14, 2015: Assembly manual for “Cherokey” robotic platform

References

August 30, 2016: LattePanda featured on EEVblog Mailbag

July 31, 2016: LattePanda featured on ExplainingComputers
